pr_title: perf: Avoids logging INFO for rest-util requests, since it hurts pull query performance

timeline.bodyText:
Is this the config that production deployments use as well? Wondering if its good to document this under some troubleshooting docs?  https://docs.ksqldb.io/en/latest/operate-and-deploy/#troubleshooting ?
Don't know if it makes sense. Leave it you to make the final call.
timeline.author: vinothchandar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -65,3 +65,6 @@ log4j.logger.processing=ERROR, kafka_appender
 log4j.additivity.processing=false
 
 log4j.logger.org.reflections=ERROR, main
+
+# To acheive high throughput on pull queries, avoid logging every request from Jetty
+log4j.logger.io.confluent.rest-utils.requests=WARN

replies.bodyText: When you say production deployments, do you mean CCloud?
replies.author: AlanConfluent

replies.bodyText: No.. the docker image or however external ksqlDB users configure the server
replies.author: vinothchandar

replies.bodyText: Will make a change here as well: https://github.com/confluentinc/ksql-images/blob/master/cp-ksql-server/include/etc/confluent/docker/log4j.properties.template
replies.author: AlanConfluent

timeline.author: vinothchandar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -65,3 +65,6 @@ log4j.logger.processing=ERROR, kafka_appender
 log4j.additivity.processing=false
 
 log4j.logger.org.reflections=ERROR, main
+
+# To acheive high throughput on pull queries, avoid logging every request from Jetty

timeline.message: perf: Avoids logging INFO for rest-util requests, since it hurts pull query performance
